q: Vote-casting at the factory, which employs around 5,500 people, began on Thursday evening. Early estimates put voting turnout at 94.4 percent. The results of the ballot were expected around 2300 GMT. The voting slips that have been slipped into the factory's ballot boxes since yesterday are destined to change the country's industrial history, Silvio Berlusconi Sole 24 Ore business paper said in an editorial on Friday. The proposal announced by Sergio Marchionne would bring one billion euros($ 1.3 billion) in investments to historic Mirafiori, which would start producing

Since his return, in October, Ben Roethlisberger has tried to be a better teammate and a better person. Like the Eagles' Michael Vick , he has been contrite and has said all the right things. It would be amazing to win another Super Bowl, but it won't be like I'll say, "Do you forgive me now?' It'll just be another step in earning back everything I lost, he told the Pittsburgh Post-Gazette's Ron Cook last week. winner Felipe Esparza - are near the end of their 60-city comedy tour and coming to the American Bank Center Selena Auditorium. "Texas jokes are great, until you're in Idaho," Roy Wood said. You do border crossing, bilingual classrooms, they're not going to get that in Montana or Vermont. Lots of material is restricted to geography. "What's best about it for me is how many people who are coming out who never saw the show. It's good for comedy because it's bringing people who have never been to comedy shows to my performance. It helps my own career down the road, as well as the tour. From the moment he debuted on "Late Night with David Letterman " and opened with jokes about suicide, al-Qaida and race relations between Latinos and blacks, Roy Wood has shown that there are few subjects off limits
